Class Description
AdultPig
Abstract class representing adult pigs.
AIPlayer
An player controlled by the computer
Arrow
An arrow with a given damage
BasicDungeon
Concrete class to represents a Dungeon
BasicDungeonBuilder
Builds a basic dungeon
BasicDungeonXMLParser
Parse a basic dungeon from an XML file.
Boar
Male adult pig
Bow
A bow that can shoot arrows
Character
A character includes the main hero, monsters and unarmed characters (merchants, etc.)
CharacterPrinter  
Command
Command interface (see Command Design Pattern)
DeadPlayerException
Exception when the human player is dead
DefaultItemFactory
A default item factory
DefaultMonsterFactory
Create monsters with average attributes.
Dungeon
A Dungeon is a 3 dimension matrix of tiles.
DungeonBuilder
Build a dungeon and implements the Builder design Pattern
DungeonParser
Interface to read a dungeon from a file
FullInventoryException
Exception when the inventory is full
GameManager
Class to manage the game
GoStaircaseCommand<T extends Character>
Part of the Command Design Pattern
Hero
The Hero is played by humans.
HumanPlayer
A Human Player corresponding to a Hero
InfoPrinter
Print the information concerning the player
InvalidRoomException
Runtime exception when the room does not have the right format (e.g: is not a rectangle)
Inventory
The inventory contains items that can be used by the hero.
InventoryPrinter  
Item
Item abstract class representing object that can be used
ItemFactoryInterface
Factory interface (see Factory Design Pattern).
ItemPrinter  
Main  
Monster
Monsters are the main antagonists of the Hero
MonsterFactoryInterface
Interface to create monsters.
NonEmptyTileException
Exception when tile already has a character
Player<T extends Character>
Generic player Instance of Character (either Monster or Human)
Potion  
Room
A Room is a rectangle of tiles with meta-info (description and level in the dungeon).
RoomBuilder
Build a room
RoomPrinter
Print a room
Shield  
Shoat
A young, newly-weaned pig (piglet).
Sow
Female adult pig
Staircase
A staircase element object to move from one tile to another.
Sword  
TestClone  
Tile
A tile is the component of a room.
TilePrinter
